column5: The colors that have worked best for us are gold, green, chartruese, pink, firetiger. Please share.

I don't find any difference in color. I used to use plain, unpainted, lead jigs and they worked fine. The live bait choice is the important factor. Right now I find live minnows outfish live leeches by 4 to 1. Next week who knows? The odd time I use bottoms bouncers and spinners I do find red works best for me.

Let's see - if I had one choice to catch walleyes it would be a white jig and a minnow. Other jigs would be gold and watermelon. For spinners, gold, gold or gold and maybe a silver, red & white and orange/chartruese to make the tackle box look prettier.
Depends on so many variables. I've really liked black with gold/yellow eyes in the past. Have had huge success on every color really.

When the suns out gold When the clouds are covering the sun I love parrot whistler jigs. Pink and orange whistler jigs work well on cloudy days also. I also like gold spinners and the pink charmer ones from toms tackle.
I still have a Color C Lector that I use on slow days :-)
Yellow or white, black or brown.
Pink, white, gold. All on 1 jig
I like the Strobe jig from J B lures it's a hammered gold jig lots of reflecting surface.
